name: temporally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to time: The two fossils were found in temporally distant strata, so there is no reason to believe the organisms that produced them lived at the same time. Doctors determined that the patient's exposure to the toxin was temporally related to the onset of her symptoms.
More examplesFewer examplesThe two incidents were far apart enough spatially and temporally that one could safely assume they weren't related. The local history museum is arranged temporally, with a different room for each century. The play is not temporally specific, though the sets seem to date from the 1950s.
